label: 大僧正
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: The highest Buddhist official, being at the head of the Buddhist Hierarchy (Sōgō) Those Buddhist priests who held this post and are mentioned in this book are as follows, being, listed in the order of their appearance in the text: Gyōgi [Gyōki], Zōmyō, Ryōgen （Jikei [Jie]-Daishi）, Kanchō, Kanju, Gakyō, Kakkei, Keien, Saishin, Gyōmei, Myōson, Eien, Shimpan, Myōkai, Kakuen, Ninkaku, Ryūmei, Chūjin, Zōyo, Kakushin, Kanjo, Gyōson, Toba-Sōjō, Gyōgen, Ryūkaku, Kakuchū, and Kampen. [僧綱、行基、増命、良源、慈恵大師、寛朝、勧修、雅慶、覚慶、慶円、済信、慶命、明尊、永円、真範、明懐、覚円、仁覚、隆明、忠尋、増誉、覚信、寛助、行尊、鳥羽僧正、行玄、隆覚、覚忠、寛遍]
